member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskModel.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the task is critical.
member.value: true if the task is critical; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The critical path in a project is indicated by a single task or a series of tasks in a project. The critical path is the longest sequence of activities that must be finished on time to complete the entire project.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskModel.Slack
member.summary: Represents the total slack of the task.
member.value: The number of days between current task end data and the project end date.
member.remarks: Slack is the amount of time that a task can be delayed without affecting the overall completion of the project. It is calculated as the difference of project end date and current task end date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttActionEventArgs`1.EnableAutoLinkValidation

member.value: true if validation should be enabled for drawing predecessors via user interaction; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: The EnableAutoLinkValidation property determines whether validation should be performed when drawing predecessors (connectors) via user interaction in the GanttChart component. By default, the EnableAutoLinkValidation property is set to true, indicating that validation is enabled. When validation is enabled, the GanttChart component will validate the drawing of predecessors based on predefined rules or constraints.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttActionEventArgs`1.PredecessorOffSetValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to restrict taskbar dragging beyond a predecessor value.
member.value: true if taskbar dragging should be restricted to a date less than the predecessor value; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The PredecessorOffSetValidation property determines whether the dragging of taskbars in the GanttChart component should be restricted based on the value of their predecessors. When PredecessorOffSetValidation is set to true, the GanttChart component will enforce a rule that prevents taskbars from being dragged to a date that is later than the date of their predecessors.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1
member.summary: Provides information about the TaskbarEditing event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.Action
member.summary: Gets the taskbar editing action. The available taskbar editing actions are: - ParentDrag - ChildDrag - RightResizing - LeftResizing - ProgressResizing
member.value: Accepts a string value that represents the taskbar editing action.
member.remarks: The Action property represents the taskbar editing action performed in the GanttChart component. It can have different values depending on the type of taskbar manipulation being performed. The available taskbar editing actions are: - ParentDrag: Indicates that the taskbar is being dragged as a parent task. - ChildDrag: Indicates that the taskbar is being dragged as a child task. - RightResizing: Indicates that the right side of the taskbar is being resized. - LeftResizing: Indicates that the left side of the taskbar is being resized. - ProgressResizing: Indicates that the progress portion of the taskbar is being resized. You can use the Action property to determine the type of taskbar editing action that is being performed and respond accordingly in your code.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the taskbar edit action.
member.value: true, if the taskbar edit action can be canceled. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.Data
member.summary: Gets the data of the task being edited.
member.value: The data object representing the task being edited.
member.remarks: The Data property represents the data of the task currently being edited in the GanttChart component. It provides access to the data object that represents the task and contains various properties such as task name, start date, end date, duration, and other task-related information. You can use the Data property to retrieve or modify the data of the task being edited and perform any necessary operations or validations on it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.ValidationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the data validation mode for predecessor relationships in the component.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the validation mode for predecessor relationships.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.EnablePredecessorValidation
member.summary: Determines whether the tasks date values are validated and updated automatically based on predecessor values.
member.value: true if validation of task date values based on predecessors is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: The EnablePredecessorValidation property controls whether Gantt task dates are validated based on their predecessor tasks. /// When set to true, task date values will be validated based on . When set to false, this validation is disabled. By default, EnablePredecessorValidation is set to true, indicating that validation is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskbarEditingEventArgs`1.EnablePredecessorOffsetValidation
member.summary: Determines whether to restrict taskbar dragging beyond a predecessor value.
member.value: true if taskbar dragging should be restricted to a date less than the predecessor value; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When EnablePredecessorOffsetValidation is set to true, the gantt chart component will enforce a rule that prevents taskbars from being dragged to a date later than the date of their predecessors. If the taskbar is dragged above the given predecessor offset value, it gets reverted to the minimum predecessor value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttAssignmentFields`2.Units
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the unit property in the resource assignment collection in the Gantt Chart.
member.value: The name of the resource units property that specifies the resource units of the resource collection in the of the Gantt chart, and referencing .

remarks.para: Use this property to specify the percentage of time or quantity dedicated to a task for a work or resource.

Examples: - Specify 100% if the resource is to work full-time on the assignment. This is the default for all assignments. - Specify 50% if the resource is spending half the available time on this assignment. - Specify 300% if three full-time equivalent resources are working on this assignment. - Specify 250% if two full-time resources and one half-time resource are working on this assignment.
When you want to specify how much of a work resource's time is dedicated to a specific task, or indicate the quantity of material for an assignment, use this property to define assignment units.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttDataOperations.UpdateDependentRecords``1(Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt{``0},System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},``0)
member.summary: Validates the start date and end date of dependent tasks with current edited task data and returns the collection of resultant data.
member.remarks: When data is loaded on demand in gantt chart, only current view port data is available to Gantt Chart. Hence during CRUD operations, Gantt Chart cannot identify the dependent tasks which edited data affects. Using this method, we can identify the dependent tasks data in server end and update it.
member.param: Instance of Gantt chart.
Input data source against which dependent tasks needs to be validated.
Edited task data.
member.returns: List - updated records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AddDialogFields
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of collection which provides information on tab sections within the dialog for adding new records and the column fields of the grid within each tab section.
member.value: A List instance of .
member.remarks: The tabs that contain the editors for columns include: General:A tab for entering values for the columns of a new gantt record. Dependency: A tab for editing dependencies. Resources: A tab for editing resources. Notes: A tab for editing notes.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" AddDialogFields=@addDialogFields Toolbar="@(new List<string>(){ "Add"})">
             <GanttTaskFields Id="TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress"  Dependency="Predecessor" ParentID="ParentId">
             </GanttTaskFields>
             <GanttEditSettings AllowAdding="true"></GanttEditSettings>
             </SfGantt>
             @code{
             private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
             private List<GanttAddDialogField> addDialogFields { get; set; } = new List<GanttAddDialogField>()
             {
               new GanttAddDialogField(){ Fields = new string[]{"TaskId","TaskName","EndDate","Duration"}, HeaderText = "General" , Type = GanttDialogFieldType.General},
               new GanttAddDialogField(){ Fields = new string[]{"Dependency"}, HeaderText="Predecessor" ,Type = GanttDialogFieldType.Dependency }
             };
             }

member.value: trueIf filtering of the data in the control is allowed; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can cancel or customize the filtering action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowReordering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether reordering is allowed.
member.value: true Enables reordering in the application.; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. You can cancel or customize the column reordering action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow resizing of Gantt columns.
member.value: true Enables resizing in the application; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can cancel or customize the resizing action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow row reordering in Gantt.
member.value: true If need to allow row drag and drop in Gantt; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can cancel or customize the row reorder action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow row and cell selection in Gantt.
member.value: true If need to allow selection of Gantt Record; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: To perform the multi-selection, hold CTRL key and click the desired rows/cells. To select range of rows/cells, hold SHIFT key and click the rows/cells.The default value is false. You can cancel or customize the selection action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow sorting of records when column header is clicked.
member.value: true If need to allow sorting of records; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can cancel or customize the sorting action through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AllowUnscheduledTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow rendering of unscheduled tasks in Gantt.
member.value: true If need to allow unscheduled tasks in Gantt; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can create or update the tasks with anyone of start date, end date, and duration values or none. You can enable or disable unscheduled tasks in Gantt chart by setting the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.BaselineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for baseline taskbar.
member.value: The background color can be specified as a color name, such as "Orange", or as its hexadecimal value, such as "#FFA500"..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.CollapseAllParentTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render root tasks in collapsed state at initial rendering of Gantt Chart.
member.value: true if root tasks are rendered in collapsed state; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can use method for dynamic collapsing of all parent tasks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary: Gets or Sets bulit-in menu items of Gantt columns.
member.value:
Column menu items, for example ColumnMenuItems = "@(new string[] { "AutoFillColumns","AutoFitThisColumn"})". The available built-in Column menu items are,
AutoFitAllColumns
Auto fit all columns
AutoFitThisColumn
Auto fit the current column
SortAscending
Sort the current column in ascending order
SortDescending
Sort the current column in descending order
ColumnChooser
To show/hide the TreeGrid columns
Filter
Filter options will show based on filterSettings property
member.remarks: Displays the column menu items when clicking the menu icon on column headers. ShowColumnMenu should be enabled.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" ShowColumnMenu="true" AllowSorting="true">
             <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
                Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
             </GanttTaskFields>
             </SfGantt>
             @code{
             private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
             private string[] columnMenuItems = new string[] { "AutoFitAll", "AutoFit", "SortAscending" };
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of collection which provides details of grid's columns in Gantt Chart.
member.value: A List instance of .
member.remarks: The columns in the Gantt Chart are used to display the values of the fields from the records of the bound data source.If this property is not set, then the columns are automatically populated based on property.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" Columns=columns>
                    <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
                     Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
                    </GanttTaskFields>
                </SfGantt>
                @code{
                private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
                private List<GanttColumn> columns { get; set; } = new List<GanttColumn>()
                {
                    new GanttColumn() { Field = "TaskId", HeaderText = "ID", Width = "150" },
                    new GanttColumn() { Field = "TaskName", HeaderText = "Task Name", Width = "300" },
                    new GanttColumn() { Field = "Duration", HeaderText = "Duration", Width = "200" }
                };
                }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ConnectorLineBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the connector line in Gantt chart.
member.value: A string value which represents the color in CSS format, for example "#ff00ff".The default value is "transparent".
member.remarks: The connector lines are used to represent the dependency relationship between tasks in Gantt chart.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" ConnectorLineBackground="Red"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ConnectorLineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the connector line.
member.value: The width is specified in pixels. The default connector line width is 1. This property is used to determine the width of the line that connects tasks in a project.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ContextMenuItems
member.summary: Gets or sets both built-in and custom context menu items.
member.value: A list of built-in context menu items names or instance of for custom items.

example.code:
<SfGantt @ref="Gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection" ContextMenuItems=contextMenuItems EnableContextMenu="true">
                <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress"
                    Dependency="Predecessor" ParentID="ParentId"></GanttTaskFields>
               <GanttEditSettings AllowAdding = "true"></GanttEditSettings>
                <GanttEvents ContextMenuItemClicked = "ContextMenuItemClickedHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
             private SfGantt<TaskData> Gantt;
             private object contextMenuItems = new List<object> { "Add", "TaskInformation", new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ContextMenuItemModel { Text = "Refresh", Target = ".e-content", Id = "refresh" } };
             private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
             private async Task ContextMenuItemClickedHandler(ContextMenuClickEventArgs<TaskData> args)
             {
               if (args.Item.Id == "refresh")
               {
                  await Gantt.RefreshAsync();
               }
             }
             }

member.remarks:
The available built-in items are,
AutoFitAll Auto fit the size of all columns
AutoFit Auto fit the current column
SortAscending Sort the current column in ascending order
SortDescending Sort the current column in descending order
TaskInformation Displays the current task.
Save Saves the edited Task
Cancel Cancels the edited Task
DeleteTask Deletes the current Task
Add Adds a new row to the Gantt
Convert Convert Current Task to Milestone or vice-versa
Indent Indent the selected record to one level
Outdent Outdent the selected record to one level
DeleteDependency Deletes the current dependency task link.
Context menu items display when clicking mouse right. Enable the built in context menu item using EnableContextMenuItems.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for rendering gantt rows.
member.value: The data source value can be of any type that implements IEnumerable.
member.remarks: To consume data from remote service or custom adaptor, component has to be used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: An event that is raised when data source is updated in Gantt Chart.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provides updated data.

example.code:
<SfTreeGrid>
                <TreeGridEvents DataSourceChanged="DataUpdateHandler" TValue="BusinessObject"></TreeGridEvents>
            </SfTreeGrid>
            @code {
                public void DataUpdateHandler(IEnumerable<TValue> args)
                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the date format used to display dates in the Gantt Chart.
member.value: This property should be set to a string that represents a valid date format. Examples of valid Date format "MM/dd/YYYY". The default format is based on the culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DayWorkingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of which represents the working time for a project.
member.remarks: The working time is used to calculate the duration of tasks and the completion of the project. provides various properties to customize the working time. The default day working time from 8.00 To 17.00.
member.value: A List instance of .

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" DayWorkingTime=ganttDayWorkingTimes>
            <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private List<GanttDayWorkingTime> ganttDayWorkingTimes = new List<GanttDayWorkingTime>()
            {
                new GanttDayWorkingTime(){From= 9, To= 13},
                new GanttDayWorkingTime(){From =14, To= 20}
            };
            private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to encode HTML of the header and content cells.
member.value: true If need to disable html encode; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: If 'DisableHtmlEncode' is set to false, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DurationUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit for duration field in the Gantt chart.
member.value:
The default value is of type and represents the unit for duration field in the Gantt chart. The available duration units are,
Day Unit value of duration is measured as day.
Minute Unit value of duration is measured as minute.
Hour Unit value of duration is measured as hour.
member.remarks: Used to map duration unit of all tasks from data source.

example.code: <SfGantt DurationUnit="DurationUnit.Day"> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EditDialogFields
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of collection which provides information on tab sections within the dialog for editing a records and the column fields of the grid within each tab section.
member.value: A List instance of .
member.remarks: The tabs that contain the editors for columns include: General:A tab for entering values for the columns of a new gantt record. Dependency: A tab for editing dependencies. Resources: A tab for editing resources. Notes: A tab for editing notes.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" EditDialogFields=@editDialogFields Toolbar="@(new List<string>(){ "Edit"})">
             <GanttTaskFields Id="TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress"  Dependency="Predecessor" ParentID="ParentId">
             </GanttTaskFields>
             <GanttEditSettings AllowEditing="true"></GanttEditSettings>
             </SfGantt>
             @code{
             private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
             private List<GanttEditDialogField> editDialogFields { get; set; } = new List<GanttEditDialogField>()
             {
               new GanttEditDialogField(){ Fields = new string[]{"TaskId","TaskName","EndDate","Duration"}, HeaderText = "General" , Type = GanttDialogFieldType.General},
               new GanttEditDialogField(){ Fields = new string[]{"Dependency"}, HeaderText="Predecessor" ,Type = GanttDialogFieldType.Dependency }
             };
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EditSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of which configures CRUD action behavior in Gannt Chart.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize editing operations.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EditSettings=ganttEditSettings Toolbar = "@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Edit"})">
                <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
                </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            private GanttEditSettings ganttEditSettings { get; set; } = new GanttEditSettings()
            {
                AllowAdding = true,AllowEditing= true, AllowDeleting= true
            };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable all built-in context menu Items.
member.value: true if need to enable all built-in Context menu items; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: You can customize the context menu actions through and event handlers.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnableContextMenu="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render only the rows visible within the view-port and render timeline cells twice the width of the gantt element. Gantt load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling and timeline cells on horizontal scrolling.
member.value: true if need to enable virtualization; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: If 'EnableVirtualization' set to true, then the Gantt will render only the rows visible within the view-port and also loads project with large time span with better performance. Subsequent rows and timeline cells are loaded on vertical scrolling and horizontal scrolling respectively.This helps to load large dataset with large timespan in Gantt.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnableVirtualization="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableRowVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable row virtualization on the grid. When enabled, only the rows visible within the viewport are rendered and on vertical scrolling, subsequent rows are loaded.
member.value: true if need to enable row virtualization to render only the rows visible within the viewport, which enhances performance; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If `EnableRowVirtualization` set to true, then the Gantt loads only the rows that are visible within the viewport, which improves performance for large datasets.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnableRowVirtualization="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableTimelineVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable timeline virtualization on the chart side. When enabled, only the timeline cells in the current viewport are rendered and subsequent timeline cells are loaded dynamically on horizontal scrolling.
member.value: true If need to enable timeline virtualization to load project with larger timespan with better performance; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If `EnableTimelineVirtualization` set to true, then the Gantt loads only the timeline cells thrice the width of the Gantt element, which improves performance for large time span.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnableTimelineVirtualization ="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable the column virtualization for the Gantt.
member.value: true if need to enable column virtualization; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If 'EnableColumnVirtualization' is set to true, then the Gantt will Initially, render only the columns that are in the current viewport and also load projects with a large number of columns with better performance. Subsequent columns are loaded on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load a large dataset with a large number of columns in the Gantt.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnableColumnVirtualization="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.LoadChildOnDemand
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to load child record on demand in remote data binding. Initially parent records are rendered in collapsed state.
member.value: true If need to load only parent records at initial load, otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Loading child records on demand can improve the performance of data-bound controls with a large number of records. Child records are only loaded when they are requested, rather than loading all child records at once.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to persist the Gantt state while refreshing the web page.
member.value: true If need to persist Gantt state, otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Gantt state is saved in the browser local storage by which the properties of the Gantt will be retained even after refreshing the page.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" EnablePersistence="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnablePredecessorValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to validate the predecessor.
member.value: true if need to enable predecessor validation; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Enabling predecessor validation ensures that the relationships between tasks are properly maintained. You can perform custom validations through event handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.DependencyTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the dependency types in Gantt Chart.
member.value: A List instance of .The default value is a list containing DependencyType.FS, DependencyType.SS, DependencyType.FF, and DependencyType.SF.
member.remarks: Only the dependency types specified in the list are allowed for mapping relationships between multiple tasks in the Gantt chart. The type specified in the first index of the `DependencyTypes` property will be the default type.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" DependencyTypes="@(new List<DependencyType>() { DependencyType.FS })" > </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AutoCalculateDateScheduling
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to auto calculate start and end-date by using the cases mentioned in this UG.
member.value: false to skip the auto calculation of scheduling dates; otherwise, true. By default, the property value is true.
member.remarks: Disable the scheduling date validation, it will not change the dates value available in the data source. Also, it will improve the load time performance for the valid data source.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" AutoCalculateDateScheduling="false"> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render Gantt Chart component in right to left direction, and fields are accessible in right to left
member.value: true if need to enable rendering component in right to left direction; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property is used to enable or disable the RTL layout for the Gantt chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.TaskType
member.summary: Defines the behavior of tasks in Gantt Chart.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies task behavior. The default type is Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskType.FixedUnit.
member.remarks:
The availble Task types are,
None Fields are None.
FixedDuration Duration task field will remain constant while updating resource unit or work field.
FixedWork Work field will remain constant while updating resource unit or duration field.
FixedUnit Resource units will remain constant while updating duration or work field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EventMarkers
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of instances that configure the events displayed in the Gantt Chart.
member.value: A List instance of .
member.remarks: The class provides various properties to customize event markers in the Gantt Chart.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" EventMarkers=events>
            <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
               Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            public List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            private List<GanttEventMarker> events { get; set; } = new List<GanttEventMarker>()
            {
               new GanttEventMarker(){ Day = new DateTime(2019, 04, 11), Label = "Project approval and kick-off", CssClass = "e-custom-event-marker" }
            };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.FilterSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of the class, which is used to configure the filtering action in the Gantt Chart.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: The enum class provides various options to customize the filter action.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" AllowFiltering="true" FilterSettings=ganttFilterSettings>
            <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private GanttFilterSettings ganttFilterSettings = new GanttFilterSettings()
            {
                HierarchyMode = FilterHierarchyMode.None
            }
            public List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.GridLines
member.summary: Defines how to show borders of row and cells in Gantt Chart.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies whether to render horizontal and vertical border lines. The default value is Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridLine.Horizontal.
member.remarks:
The availble grid lines are,
Both Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines.
None No grid lines are displayed.
Horizontal Displays the horizontal grid lines only.
Vertical Displays grid lines based on the theme.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" GridLines="GridLine.Horizontal"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> <GanttSelectionSettings Mode = "Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SelectionMode.Cell" ></ GanttSelectionSettings > </ SfGantt >

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.KeySettings
member.summary: Gets or Sets an instance of to configure the hot keys of Gantt Chart.
member.value: An instance of
member.remarks: class provides the properties to customize the hot keys.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" KeySettings=ganttkeySettings>
               <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            <GanttSelectionSettings Mode = "Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SelectionMode.Cell" ></ GanttSelectionSettings >
            </ SfGantt >
            @code{
            private GanttKeySettings ganttkeySettings = new GanttKeySettings()
            {
                MoveLeftCell = "Shift+LeftArrow"
            };
            public List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the Gantt component container.
member.value: The height of the Gantt chart should be set to a specific pixel or percentage or auto, for example "500px". The default value is "auto".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.HighlightWeekends
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to highlight all the weekend days. It is applicable only on day timeline mode.
member.value: true if need to enable the weekend highlights; otherwise, false.The default value is fasle.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" HighlightWeekends="true"> <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId"> </GanttTaskFields> <GanttSelectionSettings Mode = "Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SelectionMode.Cell" ></ GanttSelectionSettings > </ SfGantt >

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.Holidays
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of collection in the Gantt chart to display holidays.

example.code:

            <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            </ SfGantt >
            @code{

                new GanttHoliday(){ From = new DateTime(2022, 04, 11), To = new DateTime(2022, 04, 12), Label = "Public holidays"},
            };
            public List<TaskData> TaskCollection { get; set; }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Gantt DOM element's Id.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.Toolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets the toolbar items in Gantt.
member.value:
The available built-in toolbar items are:
Add Adds a new record.
Edit Edits the selected task.
Update Saves the edited task.
Delete Deletes the selected task.
Cancel Cancels the edit state.
Search Searches tasks by the given key.
ExpandAll Expands all the task of Gantt.
CollapseAll Collapses all the task of Gantt.
PrevTimeSpan Extends timeline with one unit before the timeline start date
NextTimeSpan Extends timeline with one unit after the timeline finish date.
ZoomIn Zoom-in the timeline
ZoomOut Zoom-out the timeline
ZoomToFit Displays all tasks within the viewable Gantt chart within current view port.
ExcelExport Exports Gantt data in Excel format.
CsvExport Exports Gantt data in CSV format.
member.remarks: The toolbar items are strings that represent built-in or custom actions that can be performed on the Gantt tasks. Both built-in and custom toolbar items can be added to toolbar.

example.code: <SfGantt @ref = "Gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Cancel", "Delete", "Edit", "Update", new ItemModel() { Text = "QuickFilter", TooltipText = "Quick Filter", PrefixIcon = "e-click", Id = "QuickFilter" }})"> </SfGantt>

member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: The class provides the properties to customize the tooltip setting.

example.code:
@{
TaskID: @context.TaskId
}

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.CopyHierarchyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode for copying the hierarchy of the selected data in the tree grid rows.
member.remarks: This property determines the way in which the hierarchy of the selected data in the tree grid should be copied. The available built-in items are, `Parent`: Copy the selected data with parent record. `Child`: Copy the selected data with child record. `Both`: Copy the selected data with both parent and child record. `None`: Copy only the selected record.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies how the data is copies to clipboard. The default mode is Syncfusion.Blazor.TreeGrid.CopyHierarchyType.Parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableCriticalPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the critical task and the chain of linked tasks in the Gantt Chart should be highlighted.
member.value: true if the tasks that affect the project's end date will be highlighted in the Gantt Chart; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The critical path in a project is indicated by a single task or a series of tasks in a project. Critical path is the longest sequence of activities that must be finished on time to complete the entire project

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ShowOverallocation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether to highlight the time period in chart side for the resource assigned with multiple tasks happening on the same time period.
member.value: true if overallocated resource's taskbar in chart side should be highlighted; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The time period in chart side is highlighted with square brackets. This can be useful for identifying and managing resource conflicts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.TaskbarSettings

member.value: An instance of .

example.code:

</GanttTaskbarSettings> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableAdaptiveUI
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable the adaptive user interface (UI) that adjusts the Gantt DOM elements with different alignment and layout, improving user interaction on mobile and tablet devices.
member.value: true to enable the adaptive UI in mobile and tablet devices; false to disable it. The default value is false. ///
member.remarks: Enabling the adaptive UI allows users to interact seamlessly with the elements of the Gantt chart on mobile and tablet devices. The mobile and tablet adaptive layouts are enabled for various actions, including filtering, add dialog, edit dialog, and viewing dependency details in the grid view of task information dialogs.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.OverscanCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of additional items to be rendered in the DOM before and after the visible items (based on ) when virtual scrolling is enabled in gantt.
member.value: The number of additional items to pre-render before and after the visible items (based on PageSize). The default value is 0.
member.remarks: Adjusting this property can enhance scrolling performance and optimize rendering, especially for large datasets in a virtualized Gantt Chart. By pre-rendering a buffer of extra items that are not yet visible, the component minimizes the need for frequent re-rendering while scrolling. This optimization results in a smoother and more responsive user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of items displayed per page when virtual scrolling feature is enabled..
member.value: An integer value representing the number of items displayed per page.
member.remarks: This property specifies the number of visible items on each page, ensuring a clear and organized view of the Gantt Chart. Without this setting, twice the number of records based on the gantt content height are displayed per page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableRowHover
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable hovering effect on Gantt chart rows while mouse over it.
member.value: true If need to enable hovering effect; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: While hovering on the row, the background color of the row element changes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AddPredecessor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the dependency between the tasks. Task relationships are categorized into four types based on the start and finish dates of the task. SScannot start the task until the dependent task also start. SFcannot finish the task until the dependent task aso start. FScannot start the task until the dependent task is completed. FFcannot finish the task until the dependent task is Completed.
member.param: The task value of `Id` property of class.
The dependency relationship type.
member.remarks: Adds the dependency between the tasks by passing TaskId and dependency type.

example.code:
<button @onclick="AddPredecessorFunc">Add Predecessor</button>
            <SfGantt @ref="gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection">
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            public void AddPredecessorFunc()
            {
               gantt.AddPredecessor(12,"4FS");
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AddPredecessor(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the dependency between the tasks. Task relationships are categorized into four types based on the start and finish dates of the task. SScannot start the task until the dependent task also start. SFcannot finish the task until the dependent task also start. FScannot start the task until the dependent task also completed. FFcannot finish the task until the dependent task also completed.
member.param: The task of value id property of class.
The dependency relationship type.

example.code:
<button @onclick="AddPredecessorfunc">Add Predecessor</button>
            <SfGantt @ref = "gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection">
                <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
                    Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" Child="SubTasks">
                </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            private async Task AddPredecessorFunc()
            {
                await gantt.AddPredecessor(9245fe4a-d402-451c-b9ed-9c1a04247482,3F2504E0-4F89-11D3-9A0C-0305E82C3301 FS); /// pass task id and predecessor type.
            }
            }

SScannot start the task until the dependent task also start. SFcannot finish the task until the dependent task also start. FScannot start the task until the dependent task also completed. FFcannot finish the task until the dependent task also completed.

The dependency relationship type.

example.code:

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.AddRecordAsync(`0,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.RowPosition},System.Object)
member.summary: Adds the new record into gantt chart asynchronously.
member.param: The new record to be added.
The index in which new record is to be added.
The position such as Below, Above or Child, in which new record is to be added.
The resourceData is added to the new resource assignment collection when adding a new task record.
member.remarks: When index and position parameter are not passed, new record is added at top first row index. should be true.

example.code:
<button @onclick="AddItemFunc">Add Record</button> 
            <SfGantt @ref="gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection"> 
                <GanttAssignmentFields TValue="TaskData" TAssignment="ResourceAssignmentData" PrimaryKey="Id" TaskID="TaskId" ResourceID="ResourceId" Units="Unit" DataSource="@ResourceAssignmentCollection"> 
                </GanttAssignmentFields> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt; 
            private async Task AddItemFunc() 
            { 
                ResourceAssignmentData resourceAssignmentData = new ResourceAssignmentData() 
                { 
                    Id = 14, 
                    TaskId = 2, 
                    ResourceId = 5, 
                    Unit = 40 
                }; 
               TaskData data = new TaskData(30,"ProjectApproval", new DateTime(2022,04,01),new DateTime(2022,04,05),"5",56,29); 
               await gantt.AddRecordAsync(data,29, RowPosition.Below, resourceAssignmentData); 
            } 
            }

            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.EnableItems(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable the toolbar items dynamically.
member.param: Indexes of toolbar Items to be enabled or disabled
A boolean value indicating whether the items should be enabled (true) or disabled (false).
member.returns: None
member.remarks: This method can be used to enable or disable items in a list, depending on the value of the isEnable parameter. If `isEnable` is set to true, the items will be enabled. If `isEnable` is set to false, the items will be disabled.

example.code:
<button @onclick="EnableItemFunc">Enable Items</button>
            <SfGantt @ref="gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection"  Toolbar="Toolbaritems">
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            public List<ItemModel> Toolbaritems = new List<ItemModel>() { new ItemModel() { Text = "Quick Filter", TooltipText = "Quick Filter", Id = "quickfilter" },
            new ItemModel() { Text = "Clear Filter", TooltipText = "Clear Filter", Id = "clearfilter" }};
            }
            private async Task EnableItemFunc()
            {
               await gantt.EnableItems(new List<int>() { 0,1 },true);
            }
            }

member.summary: Asynchronously scrolls a specific row or column into current view port.
member.param: The index of the column to scroll horizontally. If not provided, defaults to -1.
The index of the row to scroll vertically. If not provided, defaults to -1.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous scrolling operation.
member.remarks: Programmatically scrolls to view particular data in grid part of Gantt. If both and are set to -1, the method wil scroll to the top left corner.
member.code:
<SfButton @onclick="Scroll">Scroll to row/column</SfButton>
            <SfGantt @ref="Gantt">

            </SfGantt>
            public void Scroll()
            {
            Gantt.ScrollIntoViewAsync(4, 3);
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ExportToExcelAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties)
member.summary: Asynchronously Exports the Gantt chart data to Excel file.
member.param: An object containing the properties of the excel export. The options for customizing the excel document during export.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous excel export operation.
member.remarks: should contain information such as file name, sheet name, data to be exported and any other information related to excel export. class provides various properties to customize Excel export. should be enabled.

example.code:
<SfGantt @ref="gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection"Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "ExcelExport" })">
            <GanttEvents OnToolbarClick="ToolbarClickHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            public async Task ToolbarClickHandler(Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ClickEventArgs args)
            {
             Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties ExportProperties = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties();
             Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelStyle ThemeStyle = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelStyle()
            {
               FontName = "Segoe UI",
               FontColor = "#666666",
               FontSize = 12
            };
            Theme.Header = ThemeStyle;
            Theme.Record = ThemeStyle;
            ExportProperties.Theme = Theme;
             if (args.Item.Text == "Excel export")
             {
               await this.Gantt.ExcelExport(ExportProperties);
             }
             }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.FilterByColumnAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Filters the Gantt chart data based on the specified column and criteria asynchronously.
member.param: The name of the column by which the Gantt chart data will be filtered.
The filtering operator represented as a string. See for available operators.
The value used for filtering the specified column.
Specifies a predicate condition (e.g., AND, OR) for filtering multiple values. It is useful for multiple values filtering. Use null if not applicable and it is optional parameter.
Specifies whether the filtering operation should be case-sensitive. It is an optional parameter.
Specifies whether the filtering operation ignores accent differences. It is an optional parameter.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous filter operation.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously filters the Gantt chart data by the specified column and criteria. Additional options such as predicate, enableMatchCase, and isIgnoreAccent can be utilized to customize the filtering operation. The predicate parameter allows for specifying a predicate condition (e.g., AND, OR) for filtering multiple values, which is optional.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.OpenEditDialogAsync(System.Guid)
member.summary: This method opens an edit dialog for a task with the given task ID.
member.param: The task of value Id property of class to be deleted.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: This method uses the TaskID to retrieve the task from the records collection and then opens a dialog for editing its properties. The method should be awaited to ensure that the task has been retrieved and the dialog has been opened before continuing execution. should be true.

            }

member.param: A tuple representing the (row,column) index of the cell to be selected.
A boolean value representing whether the cell should be toggled on or off. If null, the cell's current state will not be changed.

            {

            }
            }

member.remarks: This method can be used to reorder a row in the gantt chart in an asynchronous manner. The method will update the index of the row without blocking the current thread.             {

            }
            }

member.summary: Expands the records along with its parent at specific hierarchical level.
member.param: The hierarchical level until which the rows to be Expanded.
member.remarks: This method can be used to expand the records to a certain level in an asynchronous manner. The method will update the records without blocking the current thread. The task completes when the expand operation is finished. The level parameter should be a non-negative integer representing the level of the records to expand to. The root parent level is 0.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

example.code:
<button @onclick="ExpandLevel">ExpandLevel</button>
            <SfGantt @ref = "gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection">
                <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
                    Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" Child="SubTasks">
                </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            private async Task ExpandLevel()
            {
                await gantt.ExpandAtLevelAsync(12); /// pass the hierarchical level
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.PreventRender(System.Boolean)

member.param: Indicates wheter the component should be prevented from re-rendering or not. Defalut is true.

            }
            }

                    Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" Child="SubTasks">

            </SfGantt>

            {

            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.RefreshColumnsAsync
member.summary: Refreshed the gantt chart with columns changes, if any.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous refresh operation.
member.remarks: This method updates the columns in the class asynchronously. Refresh the Gantt chart columns when column property values are updated externally. It returns a task that can be awaited to get the result of the operation.

example.code:
<button @onclick="ClickHandler">RefreshColumns</button>
            <SfGantt @ref="gantt" DataSource="@TaskCollection">
                <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
                    Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" Child="SubTasks">
                </GanttTaskFields>
                   <GanttColumns>
                       <GanttColumn Field="TaskId"></GanttColumn>
                       <GanttColumn Field="TaskName"></GanttColumn>
                   </GanttColumns>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            private async Task ClickHandler()
            {
                gantt.Columns[0].Width = "250";
                gantt.RefreshColumnsAsync();
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.GetPersistDataAsync
member.summary: Returns the serialized gantt chart properties to be maintained in the persisted state.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.The result of the task is a string that contains the persist data. System.Threading.Tasks.Task.
member.remarks: The persist data returned by this method should be stored in a secure location and encrypted if necessary. Ensure that the storage used in this method is reliable and can handle high read/write workloads. Users can use this method to later restore the gantt chart state through method.

example.code:
<button id="GetPersistence" @onclick="GetPersistence">Get Persistence</button>
            <SfGantt @ref = "gantt" EnablePersistence=true DataSource="@TaskCollection">
             <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate"
             Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId">
             </GanttTaskFields>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            public string currentState;
            private async Task GetPersistence()
            {
            currentState= await gantt.GetPersistDataAsync();
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.SetPersistDataAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a already saved state of the Gantt chart asynchronously.
member.param: Serialized gantt chart properties to apply to current state.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: The persist data passed as a parameter should be stored in a secure location and encrypted if necessary. Ensure that the storage used in this method is reliable and can handle high read/write workloads. Users can view pre stored state easily in gantt chart. Current state can be stored using method.

example.code:
<button id="SetPersistence" @onclick="SetPersistence">Set Persistence</button>
            <SfGantt @ref = "gantt" EnablePersistence=true DataSource="@TaskCollection">
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            private string currentState;
            private async Task SetPersistence()
            {
            await gantt.SetPersistDataAsync(currentState);
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.ResetPersistDataAsync
member.summary: Resets the current state and refreshes the gantt chart with original state given declaratively.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Applicable when State Persistence feature is enabled in gantt chart. This method should be used to reset any data that is meant to persist across application launches. The method should run asynchronously to avoid blocking the UI thread.

example.code:
<button id="ClearPersistence" @onclick="ClearPersistence">Clear Persistence</button>>
            <SfGantt @ref = "gantt" EnablePersistence=true DataSource="@TaskCollection">
             ........
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;
            private async void ClearPersistence()
            {
            await gantt.ResetPersistDataAsync();
            }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.GetFilteredRecordsAsync
member.summary: Retrieves all filtered records asynchronously from Gantt Chart as collection of data objects for the local data source, and returns a promise object if the Gantt Chart has remote data binding.
member.remarks: Helps to obtain the filtered data after filtering in Gantt Chart. This method should be used to retrieve a list of filtered records based on some criteria. The method should run asynchronously to avoid blocking the UI thread.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a list of filtered records of type.

example.code:
<button id=GetFilteredRecords @onclick=FilterHandler> GetFilteredRecords</button>

            <GanttEditSettings AllowFiltering=true /> 
             
            </GanttEditSettings> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
            SfGantt<TaskData> Gantt; 
            private async task  FilterHandler (){ 
               var data = await Gantt.GetFilteredRecordsAsync(); 
            } 
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.GetCurrentViewRecords
member.summary: Retrieves a list of the currently visible records in Gantt Chart. For example, when virtualization is disabled, it returns all records including the child records in expanded state. When virtualization is enabled, it returns the record and child records in current view port it might include the records over scanned for smooth scrolling.
member.remarks: This method can be called to retrieve a list of all records that are currently displayed in the view. Helps to obtain the data currenlty rendered in DOM.
member.returns: A that gives visible records in current view.

example.code:
<button id=GetCurrentViewData @onclick= GetCurrentViewData>  GetCurrentViewData </button> 
            <SfGantt @ref=Gantt DataSource=GanttData> 
            <GanttEditSettings AllowEditing=true/> 
             
            </GanttEditSettings> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
            SfGantt<TaskData> Gantt; 
            private async task  BatchAddHandler  (){ 
               var data = await Gantt.GetcurrentviewRecordsAsync (); 
            } 
            }

member.param: The resource assignment data to be added.

example.code:
<button @onclick="AddResourceAssignmentFunc">Add ResourceAssignment</button>

                </GanttAssignmentFields> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
                private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt;

                { 
                    ResourceAssignmentData newResourceAssignment = new ResourceAssignmentData() 
                    { 
                        Id = 14, 
                        TaskId = 2, 
                        ResourceId = 5 
                    }; 
                    await gantt.AddResourceAssignmentAsync(newResourceAssignment); 
                } 
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.SfGantt`1.UpdateResourceAssignmentAsync``1(``0)

member.param: The updated resource assignment data.
member.remarks: Use this method to modify the resource assignment data of an existing task resource assignment. The parameter should contain the necessary information such as the primary key, task ID, resource ID, and resource units. The updation is based on the provided primary key. If any changes are made in your collection, they will be reflected in the modified existing resource assignment.

example.code:
<button @onclick="UpdateResourceAssignmentFunc">Update ResourceAssignment</button>

                </GanttAssignmentFields> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
                private SfGantt<TaskData> gantt; 
                public async void UpdateResourceAssignmentFunc() 
                { 
                    ResourceAssignmentData updatedResourceAssignment = new ResourceAssignmentData() 
                    { 
                        Id=3, 
                        TaskId = 2, 
                        ResourceId = 5, 
                        Unit = 40 
                    }; 
                    await gantt.UpdateResourceAssignmentAsync(updatedResourceAssignmen 
                } 
            }

                </GanttAssignmentFields> 
            </SfGantt>

            }

member.summary: Defines column collection displayed in grid If the columns declaration was empty then columns are automatically populated from taskSettings value.
