member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether editing is allowed for the column.
member.value: The default value is true. If set to false, editing will be disable to the column.
member.remarks: If AllowEditing is set to false, the column will not be editable, which means that users will not be able to modify the column's values. By default, all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether filtering is allowed for the column.
member.value: The default value is true. If set to false, the column will not be filterable, and the filter menu element will be disabled for the column.
member.remarks: If AllowFiltering is set to false, the column will not be filterable, which means that users will not be able to filter the data based on the column's values, and the filter menu element will be disabled for the column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowReordering
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable or disable reordering of columns. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index.
member.value: true if need to allow reordering of columns; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Determines whether to allow or restrict reordering for specific column.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" > <GanttColumns> <GanttColumn Field = "TaskId" AllowReordering="false"></GanttColumn> </GanttColumns> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable or disable resizing of columns.
member.value: true if need to allow resizing of columns; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Determines whether to allow or restrict resizing for specific column.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" > <GanttColumns> <GanttColumn Field = "TaskId" AllowResizing="false"></GanttColumn> </GanttColumns> </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sorting is allowed for a particular column.
member.value: true if sorting is allowed for the column; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: By default, all columns are sortable. Setting this property to false disables sorting for the column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.ClipMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell content's overflow mode.
member.value: A value of the enumeration that specifies the overflow mode. The default value is .
member.remarks:
The available modes are:
: Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.
: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area and displays a tooltip when the user hovers over the ellipsis.

members.member:
Gets or sets the default value for the component when adding a new record to the Gantt chart.
The default value to be used when adding a new record to the Gantt chart.
This property is used to set the default value for the component when adding a new record to the Gantt. The default value will be used if no other value is specified. If this property is not set, the component will use some predefined value to the default columns and use an empty string for custom columns as the default value. >

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the HTML content of header and content cells should be encoded or not.
member.value: When set to true, HTML content of header and content cells is encoded. Default value is true.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true ensures that any HTML content in the header and content cells of the grid are encoded, preventing malicious content from being injected and executed by a user's browser. However, if you have already encoded the content yourself, or if you trust the source of the content, you can set this property to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the column value as a check box instead of a Boolean value.
member.value: true if the column value is displayed as a check box; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true, the column value will be displayed as a check box in the UI, and the check box will be checked if the column value is true and unchecked if the column value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.EditorSettings
member.summary:
Defines the object to customize default cell editors. The following types can be used to customize default editors.
Customizes the default numerictextbox editor.
Customizes the default dropdown editor.
Customizes the default datepicker editor.
Customizes the default checkbox editor.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.EditTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell edit template that is used as an editor for a particular column.
member.value: A that defines the template used for editing the cell. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The template can be defined as an HTML element ID. The template should define the HTML elements and components to be used when editing the cell. When the user clicks on a cell to edit it, the template is rendered in place of the cell contents. When the user saves the changes, the edited value is passed to the component that defines the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.EditType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of component used for editing.
member.value: An value that defines the type of component used for editing.
member.remarks: The EditType property is used to specify the type of component that is used for editing a cell in the Gantt chart. There are several predefined edit types, such as "Default", "TextArea", "Checkbox", and "Select". When the EditType property is set to a particular value, the Gantt chart uses the corresponding component for editing the cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of the column that is mapped with the mapping name of the DataSource.
member.value: A string representing the field name of the column. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: Use the Field property to bind the columns for sorting, filtering, and other operations. The field name must match the mapping name specified in the DataSource. If the field name is invalid or does not match the mapping name, an exception may be thrown.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.FilterSettings
member.summary: Defines the filter options to customize filtering for the particular column.
member.value: A object that represents the filter settings for the column. The default value is null, indicating that the column does not support filtering.
member.remarks: Use this property to customize the filtering behavior for a specific column. You can set various filter options, such as filter type, operator, and value. If the FilterSettings property is not set, filtering will not be available for the column. The default value of this property is null, which means that the column does not support filtering by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.FilterTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter template/UI that is used as a filter for a particular column.
member.value: A representing the template or HTML element ID for the filter.
member.remarks: Use this property to define a custom template or HTML element ID for the filter of a column. The filter template/UI can be defined as a RenderFragment representing an HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets or sets the format from the user which can be standard or custom.
member.value: The format string used for displaying the property value. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property provides a way to format the display value of the property without modifying the original data. The format can be specified as either a standard format string or a custom format string. If this property is not set, the default format string used is an empty string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.Formatter
member.summary: Gets or sets an external function used to achieve custom formatting for the cells in the component.
member.value: An external function that accepts the cell value as an input and returns a formatted string. If not specified, the default formatting for the cell value will be used.
member.remarks: The Formatter property allows you to define a custom formatting function that will be used for each cell in the component. This function should accept the cell value as an input and return a string with the desired formatting applied. The formatting function will be called before rendering each cell, allowing you to apply custom formatting logic based on the cell value or any other criteria.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the column header template that defines a customized element in the header.
member.value: A delegate representing the template to be used for rendering the header.
member.remarks: The header template can be defined as a string or as an HTML element ID. When specified as an HTML element ID, the element will be used as a reference to the template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.HeaderText
member.summary: Gets or sets the header text of the column which is used to display in the column header. If the HeaderText property is not defined, then the field name value will be assigned to the header text.
member.value: A string value that represents the header text of the column. The default value is field name.
member.remarks: Use the HeaderText property to specify the header text of the column. If the HeaderText property is not set, the field name value will be used as the header text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.HeaderTextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the column header text.
member.value: A value from the TextAlign enumeration that represents the alignment of the column header text. The default value is TextAlign.Left.
member.remarks: Use the HeaderTextAlign property to specify the alignment of the column header text. The available options for alignment are Justify, Left, Center, and Right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.HideAtMedia
member.summary: Gets or sets the media query at which the column should be hidden.
member.value: A string value that represents the media query at which the column should be hidden. The default value is an empty string, which means the column is not hidden based on a media query.
member.remarks: Use the HideAtMedia property to specify the media query at which the column should be hidden. This property accepts only valid Media Queries. If an invalid Media Query is provided, the column will not be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.IsFrozen
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the gantt column should be frozen.
member.value: A boolean value that indicates whether the gantt column should be frozen. Set to true to freeze the column and prevent it from scrolling; otherwise, set to false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the IsFrozen property to freeze the gantt column and prevent it from scrolling. When IsFrozen is set to true, the gantt column will remain fixed on the screen while the rest of the columns can be scrolled horizontally.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.Freeze
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates which side column needs to freeze.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies in which direction the columns is frozen. The default mode is Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FreezeDirection.Left.
member.remarks: Columns can be frozen both at left and right side of tree grid content. Columns in the center part of tree grid content are scrollable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.IsIdentity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column is an identity column.
member.value: true if the column is an identity column; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When IsIdentity is set to true, the primary key value for the new record is auto generated by the database. It is recommended to set the IsPrimaryKey property to true when using IsIdentity.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column is part of the primary key constraint.
member.value: true if the column is part of the primary key constraint; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When IsPrimaryKey is set to true, this column is considered as the primary key constraint. It is recommended to set IsPrimaryKey to true when using IsIdentity.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the column in pixels or percentage.
member.value: A string value that represents the maximum width of the column in pixels or percentage.
member.remarks: The MaxWidth property specifies the maximum width of the column in pixels or percentage. If the column's width is greater than the specified maximum value, it will restrict resizing beyond this value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage.
member.value: A string value that represents the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage.
member.remarks: The MinWidth property specifies the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage. If the column's width is less than the specified minimum value, it will restrict resizing beyond this value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show checkboxes in the column.
member.value: true if checkboxes are displayed in the column; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the ShowCheckbox property is set to true, checkboxes will be displayed in the column. Developers can use this feature to add checkboxes to the column for multiple selections. The default value of this property is false, which means the checkboxes will not be displayed by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttColumn.ShowColumnMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to display the menu options in each column.
member.value: true if need to enable column menu options; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Determines whether the columns should display the menu options.

example.code: <SfGantt DataSource="@TaskCollection" > <GanttColumns> <GanttColumn Field = "TaskId" ShowColumnMenu="false"></GanttColumn> </GanttColumns> </SfGantt>

member.remarks: The TextAlign property specifies the alignment of the content in the cells of the column, including the header cell. By default, the value of this property is set to . You can set this property to any value from the enumeration to align the column.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the particular column is visible or hidden.
member.value: true if the column is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Use this property to show or hide the particular column. By default, columns are displayed. When this property is set to false, the column is hidden. When it is set to true, the column is visible.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttCriticalPathSettings
member.summary: Configures the critical path settings for the Gantt chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttCriticalPathSettings.SlackValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the slack value, in number of days, which is used to determine whether a task is critical in the Gantt chart.
member.value: The number of days between the project's end date and task's end date that must elapse before the task is considered critical. The default value is zero.
member.remarks: Slack is a measure of how many days a task can be delayed without affecting the project's completion. Tasks with zero or negative slack values are critical, while tasks with positive slack values are non-critical. If a task's end date is the same as the project's end date, the slack value is 0, and the task is considered critical. For example, consider a project with an end date of January 15th, 2023. If a task has an end date of January 14th, 2023, and the slack value is zero, then the task is considered non-critical. If the slack value is 1, then the task is considered critical. On the other hand, if the task has an end date of January 16th, 2023, and the slack value is zero, then the task is considered critical. If the slack value is -2, then the task is considered non-critical.

member.remarks: This property specifies the end time of the working time range. The value should be in hours, expressed as a decimal number. For example, 17 represents 5 PM. The default value is 17, which represents the evening.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings
member.summary: Class that defines the edit settings property in Gantt.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent Gantt control.
member.value: An object that represents the parent Gantt chart control.
member.remarks: This property is used by the child components of the Gantt chart control to access the parent control, allowing for communication and coordination between the components. The attribute is used to indicate that the value of this property should be cascaded down to child components, allowing them to access the parent control without the need for explicit references or event handling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content to be rendered inside the component.
member.value: A instance that represents the child content to be rendered inside the component.
member.remarks: This property is used to define the child content to be rendered inside the component. The content can be any valid HTML markup or other components. The child content will be rendered inside the component's template wherever the @ChildContent Razor directive is used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.AllowAdding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether new records can be added to the Gantt chart.
member.value: true if new records can be added to the Gantt chart; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Use this property to control whether new records can be added to the Gantt chart. If this property is set to true, an "Add" button will be displayed on the toolbar, which allows users to add new records. If this property is set to false, the "Add" button will be hidden and users will not be able to add new records. By default, this property is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.AllowDeleting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to delete items from the gantt chart component.
member.value: true if the user is allowed to delete items; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Set this property to true to allow users to delete items. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.AllowEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the record is allowed to be edited.
member.value: true if editing is allowed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Set this property to true to allow values to be updated in the existing record. If set to false, the record will be read-only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.AllowTaskbarEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable or disable taskbar resizing, taskbar dragging, progress bar resizing and predecessor draw action in gantt chart.
member.value: true to enable taskbar editing; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When set to true, this property allows users to resize taskbars, drag them within the chart, resize the progress bars and draw dependencies between tasks. The default value of this property is false, which means that taskbar editing is disabled by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets edit mode in Gantt chart component. `Auto` - Defines cell edit mode in grid side and dialog mode in chart side. `Dialog` - Defines dialog edit mode on both sides.
member.value: The default value is EditMode.Auto.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is Auto, which means that cell editing is allowed in the grid side and dialog editing is allowed in the chart side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.NewRowPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the row position for new records of the gantt chart component.
member.value: The default value is RowPosition.Top.
member.remarks: The row position determines where new records are added when the user inserts them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.ShowDeleteConfirmDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show a confirmation dialog before deleting a record.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: If set to true, a confirmation dialog will be displayed before deleting a record. You can also cancel the delete command from the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEditSettings.AllowSchedulingOnDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow click and drag action on chart area of gantt to schedule dates and create a taskbar.
member.value: false If need to allow scheduling dates by click and drag action; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true, users can interact on gantt chart rows and schedule the task on their desired dates.

            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.TaskbarEditing
member.summary: An event that is raised when the user starts editing the taskbar.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: An event is raised when the taskbar is being edited.And that event handler recevies a object which provides the taskbar editing information and an option to cancel the taskbar edit action.

example.code:
<SfGantt DataSource = "@TaskCollection" Height="450px" Width="700px">
            <GanttTaskFields Id = "TaskId" Name="TaskName" StartDate="StartDate" EndDate="EndDate" Duration="Duration" Progress="Progress" ParentID="ParentId" Dependency="Predecessor">
            </GanttTaskFields>
            <GanttEditSettings AllowTaskbarEditing = "true" ></ GanttEditSettings >
            < GanttEvents TaskbarEditing="TaskbarEditingHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents>
            </SfGantt>
            @code{
            private void TaskbarEditingHandler(TaskbarEditingEventArgs<TValue> args)
            {
              TaskData record = args.Data;
              string actionName = args.Action;
              args.Cancel = true;
            }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.Filtering
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised before the filtering or clear filtering action is performed in the Gantt Chart.
member.remarks: The event handler receives a object, which contains details about filtering or clearing the filtering action in the Gantt Chart. This event is invoked once with Action argument set to Reset when calling the API without passing the column's field as a parameter. It notifies the clear filtering action, and the event arguments will not be updated in this case. You can prevent the clear filtering action using this event. Conversely, this event is invoked for each field with Action set to Remove when calling the ClearFilteringAsync API with the column's field name as a parameter. In this scenario, you can access detailed information in the corresponding event arguments.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.Filtered
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised after the filtered or clear filtered action is performed in the Gantt Chart.
member.remarks: The event handler receives a object, which contains details about filtering or clearing the filtering action in the Gantt Chart. This event is invoked once with Action argument set to Reset when calling the API without passing the column's field as a parameter. It notifies the clear filtering action, and the event arguments will not be updated in this case. You can prevent the clear filtering action using this event.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.Zooming
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before zoom action is performed.
member.remarks: The event handler receives a object, which provides details about the zoom action in the gantt chart.///
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGantt> 
                <GanttEvents Zooming="ZoomBeginHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
                private void ZoomBeginHandler(Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.ZoomEventArgs args) 
                { 
                    args.Cancel = true; // To cancel the zoom action and not allow it to proceed. 
                } 
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.GanttDialogOpening
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised before the dialog opens.
member.remarks: The event handler receives a object, which provides details about the edit or add action in the gantt chart.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGantt> 
                <GanttEvents GanttDialogOpening="GanttDialogOpeningHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
                private void GanttDialogOpeningHandler(Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttDialogOpenEventArgs<TValue> args) 
                { 
                       args.Cancel = true; // To cancel the dialog open. 
                } 
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttEvents`1.TaskConnectorChanging
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when beginning to connect a taskbar to another.
member.remarks: The event handler receives a object, which provides details about the taskbar and connector details.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGantt> 
                <GanttEvents TaskConnectorChanging="ConnectorLineDrawHandler" TValue="TaskData"></GanttEvents> 
            </SfGantt> 
            @code{ 
                private void ConnectorLineDrawHandler (Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.TaskConnectorChangeEventArgs <TValue> args) 
                { 
                        args.Cancel = true; // Cancel the connector line process. 
                } 
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings
member.summary: Configures the filter settings for Gantt.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for the component.
member.value: A RenderFragment that represents the child content for the component.
member.remarks: This property is used to define the child content for the component. The content can be defined using Razor syntax.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of columns to be filtered at initial rendering of the Gantt chart.
member.value: A list of PredicateModel objects representing the columns to be filtered at the initial rendering of the Gantt chart.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the columns that should be filtered at the initial rendering of the Gantt chart. To get the columns that are currently filtered, access this property after the chart has been rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings.HierarchyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter hierarchy mode for the gantt chart. The available options are, `Parent`: Shows the filtered record with parent record. `Child`: Shows the filtered record with child record. `Both` : shows the filtered record with both parent and child record. `None` : Shows only filtered record.
member.value: A FilterHierarchyMode value that specifies how the records should be filtered in the chart.
member.remarks: Use this property to set the filter hierarchy mode for the Gantt chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filter should ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.
member.value: true if diacritic characters or accents should be ignored; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify whether the filter should ignore diacritic characters or accents while filtering. If this property is set to true, then the filter will ignore diacritic characters or accents while filtering. By default, this property is set to false, which means that diacritic characters or accents are taken into account while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttFilterSettings.Operators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that allows you to customize the filter operations.
member.value: An object that defines custom filter operators for specific data types.
member.remarks: Use this property to customize the filter operators that are displayed in the filter menu for specific data types. The `Operators` property should be defined by data type (string, number, date, and boolean). Based on the data type of the column, the customized operator list will be rendered in the filter menu.

If no custom CSS class is provided, the holiday will use the default styles.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings
member.summary: Configures Gantt key settings.
member.remarks: The properties set to GanttKeySettings will handle the hot key's default action.

example.code: <SfGantt @ref="Gantt" DataSource="@GanttData"> <GanttKeySettings MoveLeftCell="Shift+LeftArrow" MoveRightCell="Tab" MoveUpCell="UpArrow" MoveDownCell=""></GanttKeySettings> ........ </SfGantt>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.MoveLeftCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets any or all of the following hot keys for the left cell movement.
Shift+Tab Moves to left cell on pressing Shift+Tab key
LeftArrow Moves to left cell on pressing LeftArrow key
Shift+LeftArrow Moves to left cell on pressing Shift+LeftArrow key
The default value are Shift+Tab,LeftArrow,Shift+LeftArrow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.MoveRightCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets any or all of the following hot keys for the right cell movement.
Tab Moves to right cell on pressing Tab key
RightArrow Moves to right cell on pressing RightArrow key
Shift+RightArrow Moves to right cell on pressing Shift+RightArrow key
The default value are Tab,RightArrow,Shift+RightArrow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.MoveUpCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets any or all of the following hot keys for the up cell movement.
Shift+Enter Moves to top cell on pressing Shit+Enter key
UpArrow Moves to top cell on pressing UpArrow key
Shift+UpArrow Moves to top cell on pressing Shift+UpArrow key
The default value are Shift+Enter,UpArrow,Shift+UpArrow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.MoveDownCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets any or all of the following hot for the down cell movement.
Enter Moves to down cell on pressing Enter key
DownArrow Moves to down cell on pressing DowArrow key
Shift+DownArrow Moves to down cell on pressing Shift+DownArrow key
The default value are Enter,DownArrow,Shift+DownArrow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.IndentRow
member.summary:
Gets or sets any hot keys combination for indenting the row.
Alt+Shift+RightArrow Indent the row on pressing Alt+Shift+RightArrow keys
The default value is Alt+Shift+RightArrow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttKeySettings.OutdentRow
member.summary:
Gets or sets any hot keys combination for outdenting the row.
Alt+Shift+LeftArrow Indent the row on pressing Alt+Shift+LeftArrow keys
The default value is Alt+Shift+LeftArrow.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings
member.summary: Configures the search settings for Gantt.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content that will be rendered inside the gantt chart component.
member.value: A representing the child content that will be rendered inside the component.
member.remarks: Use this property to provide content that will be rendered inside the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the columns to be searched at initial rendering of the Gantt chart component. You can also get the columns that were currently filtered.
member.value: An array of strings representing the fields to be searched when the Gantt is initially rendered.
member.remarks: Use this property to set the initial columns to be searched in the Gantt. By default, all columns are searched. The Fields property can also be used to retrieve the currently filtered columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.HierarchyMode
member.summary: Defines the search types of hierarchical data. The available options are, `Parent`: Shows the searched record with parent record. `Child`: Shows the searched record with child record. `Both` : shows the searched record with both parent and child record. `None` : Shows only searched record.
member.value: A value from the enum that specifies how the search should be performed on hierarchical data.
member.remarks: Use this property to set the search mode for hierarchical data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored while filtering.
member.value: The default value is false. If set to true, diacritic characters or accents will be ignored while filtering.
member.remarks: If IgnoreAccent is set to true, filtering will ignore diacritic characters or accents, which means that the filter will consider two strings that differ only by diacritic characters or accents to be the same. This property is supported by remote data alone. When the IgnoreAccent property is set to true, the IgnoreAccent key will be sent to the server and the operation should be handled at the user level.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the comparison should ignore the case of characters during filtering.
member.value: true if the comparison should be case-insensitive; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.Key
member.summary: A key word for searching the Gantt chart content.
member.value: A string value representing the keyword used for searching. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property specifies a keyword that is used to filter the Gantt content. The search operation is case-insensitive, so it can match any part of the content. To match exact text, use the Equals operator along with this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSearchSettings.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to search records.
member.value: The default value for this property is 'Operator.Contains'.
member.remarks: This property determines the type of search operation to be performed while filtering records. The 'Contains' operator matches records that have the search value anywhere in the specified field. Other supported operators include 'Equals', 'StartsWith' and 'EndsWith'.

member.value: The selection mode of the cell. The default value is .
member.remarks: Use this property to set the selection mode of the cell. The CellSelectionMode enumeration is used to set the possible values of this property. The default value of this property is CellSelectionMode.Flow.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSelectionSettings.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode for the Gantt chart control.
member.value: A value that specifies the selection mode. The default value is .
member.remarks: This property determines how the user can select elements in the Gantt control. When the is set to , the control allows the user to select entire rows of data. When the is set to , the control allows the user to select individual cells. When the is set to , the control allows the user to select both rows and cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSelectionSettings.PersistSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Gantt selection should be persisted on all operations. If 'persistSelection' set to true, then the Gantt selection is persisted on all operations.
member.value: true if the Gantt selection should be persisted on all operations; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property determines whether the Gantt control should keep the user's selection even if the user performs other operations on the control, such as sorting or filtering the data. When is set to true, the selection will be maintained even when the control is updated or refreshed. When is set to false, the selection will be lost when the control is updated or refreshed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSelectionSettings.EnableToggle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can perform a toggle action on the selection row. If 'enableToggle' set to true, then the user can able to perform toggle for the selected row.
member.value: If true, the user can perform a toggle action on the selected row. If false, the user cannot perform a toggle action on the selected row. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When true, the user can toggle the selected row by clicking on it. The toggle action will change the selected row's state, typically visually highlighting or changing the row's appearance in some way. When false, the user cannot perform the toggle action and the selected row remains in its default state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSelectionSettings.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection type for the component. They are `Single`: Allows selection of only a row or a cell. `Multiple`: Allows selection of multiple rows or cells.
member.value: Allows selection of only one row or one cell at a time. This is the default selection type.
member.remarks: When the selection type is set to , the user can select only one row or one cell at a time. When the selection type is set to , the user can select multiple rows or cells at a time. The default selection type is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSelectionSettings.AllowDragSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable selection of multiple rows and cells by dragging mouse.
member.value: true if the row and cell selection enabled when dragging mouse. Otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: To perform drag selection in grid part of Blazor Gantt, set as Multiple.
member.example:
In the below code example, enabled AllowDragSelection property
<SfGantt @ref="Gantt"> <GanttSelectionSettings AllowDragSelection = "true" Type="Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SelectionType.Multiple"></GanttSelectionSettings> </SfGantt>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortDescriptor

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortDescriptor.Direction
member.summary: Defines the direction of the sort column.
member.value: The default value of this property is SortDirection.Ascending.
member.remarks: This property specifies the direction in which the sort column will be sorted. By default, this property is set to SortDirection.Ascending.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortDescriptor.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of the sort column.
member.value: The default value of this property is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property specifies the name of the field that will be used for sorting. By default, this property is set to an empty string.

member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortDescriptors.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of sorted columns in the Gantt chart.
member.value: This property specifies the collection of columns that are currently sorted in the Gantt chart. The default value of this property is an empty list of .
member.remarks: Use this property to retrieve a collection of columns that are currently sorted in the Gantt chart.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortSettings
member.summary: Configures the sort settings of the Gantt.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortSettings.AllowUnsort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sort the gantt by clicking on the sorted column header.
member.value: A boolean value that is set to true by default, which means the user can sort the Gantt in any order by clicking on the sorted column header.
member.remarks: Set this property to false to prevent the user from getting the Gantt in an unsorted state by clicking on the sorted column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSortSettings.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns to sort at the initial rendering of the Gantt control and allows the user to get the currently sorted columns.
member.value: A list of objects that defines the columns to sort at the initial rendering of the Gantt control.
member.remarks: To specify columns for initial sorting, create one or more GanttSortDescriptor objects and add them to the Columns list. The sort order of the columns is determined by the order in which they are added to the list. To get the currently sorted columns, retrieve the Columns list and examine the properties of the GanttSortDescriptor objects it contains.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings
member.summary: Configures gantt splitter settings collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.ColumnIndex
member.summary: Defines the index of the column where the splitter bar is to be positioned in the grid. If `ColumnIndex` set as `2` then splitter bar placed at third column of grid.
member.value: An integer value representing the column index. The default value is -1.
member.remarks: This property is used to specify the location of the splitter bar in relation to the columns of the grid. If the index value is not added, the default value should be 250px. Otherwise, the value should be set to the index of the column where the splitter bar should be positioned. For example, if the value is set to 2, the splitter bar will be positioned at the third column of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of the grid part where the splitter is located.
member.value: A string representing the minimum width of the grid part. The default value is null.
member.remarks: This property is used to set the minimum width of the grid part where the splitter is located. When the user tries to move the splitter to a position that would result in a width smaller than the minimum value, the splitter will stop moving and stay at its current position.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial position of the splitter in pixels.
member.value: A string representing the initial position of the splitter in pixels.
member.remarks: This property is used to set the initial position of the splitter when the component is first loaded. The position value should be specified as a string, representing the number of pixels from the left of the grid, depending on the orientation of the splitter. If the value is null, the position of the splitter will be set to the 250px from the left of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.SeparatorSize
member.summary: Defines the size of the splitter bar for separating content in a control.
member.value: The size of the splitter bar in pixels. Default value is 4.
member.remarks: This property specifies the size of the splitter bar in pixels. The splitter bar is used to separate Gantt chart content,into grid view and chart view. The size of the splitter bar can be adjusted by the user in some scenarios, but this property sets the default size for the splitter bar. The value of this property must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.View
member.summary: Defines the predefined view of the Gantt chart. `Default` - Shows Grid side and Chart side of Gantt chart. `Grid` - Shows grid side alone in Gantt. `Chart` - Shows chart side alone in Gantt.
member.value: A string that specifies the predefined view of the Gantt chart.
member.remarks: This property specifies the predefined view of the Gantt chart. The Gantt chart displays tasks and their dependencies over a timeline. This property can be used to control which side(s) of the Gantt chart are visible by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttSplitterSettings.Collapsible
member.summary: This property is used to enable/disable splitter expand collapse feature in Gantt chart.
member.value: boolean value to enable/disable expand/collapse feature
member.remarks: It enables expand collapse icon near splitter resizer.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskbarSettings.EnableMultiTaskbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether multiple taskbars can be displayed in the parent chart row.
member.value: true if multiple taskbars are enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Multiple taskbars can be displayed only in the ResourceView of the Gantt Chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskbarSettings.AllowTaskbarDragAndDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users can drag and drop taskbars between resources in the Resource View of the Gantt Chart.
member.value: true if taskbar drag and drop is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Users can reassign tasks to resources and change the timeline of the tasks while performing drag and drop operations.

member.summary: Dispose unmanaged resources in the Syncfusion Blazor component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.BaselineEndDate
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the baseline end date of the task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the baseline end date of the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the baseline end date of a task from a data source. The baseline end date is a reference date that is used to compare the actual end date of the task to the planned end date. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid date values. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.BaselineStartDate
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the baseline start date of the task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the baseline start date of the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the baseline start date of a task from a data source. The baseline start date is a reference date that is used to compare the actual start date of the task to the planned start date. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid date values. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.Child
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the child tasks of the current task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the child tasks of the current task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the child tasks of a task from a data source. Child tasks are tasks that are part of a larger parent task. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid task IDs that match the parent task ID of the current task. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the custom CSS class for the current task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the custom CSS class for the current task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the custom CSS class of a task from a data source. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid CSS class names. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source. The custom CSS class is used to customize the appearance of the task in the UI.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.Dependency
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field that maps dependencies of tasks on initial load.
member.value: A string that represents the name of the field in the data source.
member.remarks: This property is used to define dependencies between tasks in a workflow or process, where one task must be completed before another can start. Task relationships are categorized into four types based on the start and finish dates of the task. The available types are FS,SS,SF,FF. By setting this property to the name of the corresponding field in the data source, the system can automatically determine the order in which tasks should be executed based on their dependencies.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the duration information for the task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the duration information for the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the task duration from a data source. Duration is the amount of time it takes to complete a task. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid duration values in a format that can be parsed by the system. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.DurationUnit
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the duration unit information for the task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the duration unit information for the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the task duration unit from a data source. Duration unit is the unit of time used to measure the task duration, such as days, hours, or minutes. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid duration unit values that can be recognized by the system. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.EndDate
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the end date information for the task.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the end date information for the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the task end date from a data source. End date is the date when the task is expected to be completed. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid date values in a format that can be recognized by the system. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable when the task data is loaded from a data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTaskFields.ExpandState
member.summary: Specifies the name of the data source field that contains the expand status information for the parent record.
member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the expand status information for the parent record.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the expand status of the parent record from a data source. The expand status indicates whether the parent record is expanded or collapsed by default when the Gantt chart is loaded. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid expand status values that can be recognized by the system. If an invalid or non-existent field name is provided, an exception may be thrown during runtime. This property is only applicable to parent records.

member.value: A string that specifies the name of the data source field that contains the ID information for the task.
member.remarks: This property is used to map the task ID from a data source. The ID is a unique identifier that is assigned to the task. By default, the property is empty, indicating that no mapping is performed. If a data source field is specified, it must contain valid ID values that can be recognized by the system.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.TimelineViewMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeline mode of Gantt chart header for the timeline view.
member.value: The mode for the timeline view. The default value is TimelineViewMode.None.
member.remarks: The timeline view mode determines how the timeline is displayed to the user. Possible values are TimelineViewMode.None, TimelineViewMode.Day, TimelineViewMode.Week, TimelineViewMode.Month, and TimelineViewMode.Year.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.UpdateTimescaleView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the timescale view should be auto updated on editing action.
member.value: true if the timescale view should be updated; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When set to true, the timescale view will be updated. When set to false, the timescale view will not be updated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.WeekStartDay
member.summary: Gets or sets the day of the week that the timeline view starts on.
member.value: The day of the week that the timeline view starts on. The default value is 0, which represents Sunday.
member.remarks: This property determines which day of the week the timeline view starts on. The value should be an integer between 0 and 6, where 0 represents Sunday, 1 represents Monday, and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.WeekendBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of weekend cell in week - day timeline mode.
member.value: A representing the color of the background for the weekend cell in the week - day timeline mode.
member.remarks: This property can be set to any valid CSS color value, such as a color name (e.g. "red"), a hex value (e.g. "#FF0000"), or an RGB value (e.g. "rgb(255, 0, 0)"). If this property is set to , the default background color for the weekend days will be used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.BottomTier
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings for the bottom tier timeline of the gantt chart component.
member.value: A object representing the settings for the bottom timeline tier of the gantt chart component.
member.remarks: This property allows to customize the appearance and behavior of the bottom timeline tier of the gantt chart component. If this property is not set, the default settings for the bottom timeline tier will be used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineSettings.TopTier
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings for the top tier of the gantt chart timeline.
member.value: A object representing the settings for the top timeline tier of the gantt chart component.
member.remarks: This property specifies the settings for the top timeline tier. You can customize the appearance and behavior of the timeline tier by setting the properties of the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings
member.summary: Configures gantt Timeline tier collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of timeline units combined for a single cell.
member.value: An that represents the number of timeline units combined for a single cell. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: This property allows you to control how many timeline units are combined into a single cell in the timeline view. For example, if Count is set to 2 and the timeline view displays hours, each cell will represent a two-hour period. The default value is 1, which means each cell represents a single timeline unit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeline cell format.
member.value: A that represents the timeline cell format. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property allows you to specify the format of the text displayed in the timeline cells. The format is a string that can include a combination of static text and format placeholders. For example, if the timeline displays hours, the format string "h:mm tt" would display the time in a 12-hour clock format with AM or PM. If this property is set to an empty string, the default format for the timeline unit is used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.Formatter
member.summary: Defines a method to get custom formatted values of timeline cells.
member.value: This property gets or sets the custom formatter used to get the formatted values of timeline cells. Default value is null.
member.remarks: The custom formatter method should accept a single parameter of type dynamic and return a string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.Unit
member.summary: Defines the timeline mode.
member.value: This property gets or sets the timeline mode. Default value is TimelineViewMode.Day.
member.remarks: The TimelineViewMode enum determines the type of time unit per cell. The available options are Day, Week, Month, Year.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.GanttTimelineTierSettings.FormatterTemplate
member.summary: Defines a template for formatting the timeline cells.
member.value: This property gets or sets the template for formatting the timeline cells. Default value is null.
member.remarks: The RenderFragment type allows you to define a template that can be used to format the timeline cells. The template should accept a single parameter of type GanttTimelineFormatter and return a RenderFragment.

member.summary: Receive its initial parameters from its parent in the render tree.
member.returns: Task.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.IGanttTaskModel`1.Slack
member.summary: Represents the total slack of the task.
member.value: The number of days between current task end data and the project end date.
member.remarks: Slack is the amount of time that a task can be delayed without affecting the overall completion of the project. It is calculated as the difference of project end date and current task end date.

member.summary: Gets the list of Gantt segment data of a task.

member.remarks: The Segments property provides access to the detailed segment information of a Gantt task. Segments are used to describe specific portions of a task's timeline, such as interruptions, or splits.

The Gantt chart properties containing configuration settings.

The Gantt task properties used to determine the task's start and end dates.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Gantt.Internal.GanttSegment`1.ValidateEndDateWithSegments(Syncfusion.Blazor.TreeGrid.Internal.GanttTaskItem)
member.summary: Validates the end dates of segments for a Gantt task based on the provided Gantt task properties during cell editing.
member.param: The Gantt task properties used to determine the task's end date and segments.
member.returns: A list of validated segment data with corrected end dates.
member.remarks: This method is specifically designed to validate the end dates of segments for a Gantt task when editing the task's data via the cell edit feature. It ensures that segment end dates do not exceed the task's end date. If any segments have end dates beyond the task's end date, their end dates are adjusted to match the task's end date. The corrected segment data is returned as a list for further processing.
